body: This is because magistrates sit in a part-time capacity and generally have little previous experience of the court system, so will require training, mentoring and the opportunity to gain experience. There is a general expectation that magistrates will be able to sit for at least five years before retirement.
heading: You may not be able to sit as a magistrate if you're over 65
lede: The Senior Presiding Judge will not generally appoint anyone over 65 (magistrates retire automatically at 70).
